cv_text:
Huynh Nam Khoa
+84 931822863 | khoahnse183001@fpt.edu.vn | github.com/Khoahn0101
Education
FPT University
BACHELOR PROGRAM OF INFORMATION TECHNOLOGY, 
ARTIFICIAL INTELLIGENCE 
 2023 – Current
Projects
Rain removal | Python, LSTM, Resnet.
• Implemented a rain removal project using Python, LSTM, and ResNet to enhance image clarity in adverse weather.
• Focused on removing rain from images to improve traffic light detection accuracy in adverse weather.
• Leveraged LSTM's temporal modeling capabilities to capture rain patterns and ResNet's feature extraction power for 
accurate rain detection and removal.
• Successfully restored details and visual fidelity to rain-affected images, contributing to improved object detection.
Old photos restoration| Python, Densepose, Humanpose, Openpose, LSTM, CNN.
• Developed a novel image restoration method that removes humans from images while preserving background context. 
• Employed DensePose, OpenPose, and HumanPose for precise human segmentation and pose estimation.
• Achieved a better improvement in image restoration quality.
Skills
Languages: Python, SQL , JavaScript, HTML/CSS, R.
Frameworks: React, Node.js, TensorFlow.
Developer Tools: Git, VS Code, Google Colab, PyCharm.
Libraries: pandas, NumPy, Scikit-learn.
Data Visualization: Power BI.
Other Skills: English (Intermediate), Microsoft Office(Excel, Word, PowerPoint).
• Average GPA: 3.42
• Anticipated graduation date: 12/2025
Objective
As a dedicated second-year student with a strong passion for AI, machine learning, and robotics, I am seeking an internship 
opportunity where I can apply my technical skills and contribute to innovative AI projects. With an intermediate proficiency in 
English, I am enthusiastic about collaborating with diverse teams to further develop my ability to communicate technical concepts 
effectively. I am committed to pursuing a career in AI engineering and am dedicated to continuous learning and professional 
growth.
Certifications
Data Science Fundamentals with Python and SQL
IBM Introduction to Machine Learning
Data Science with R
Big Data
Deep Learning Specialization
IBM Full Stack Software Developer

\f0\fs24 \cf0 Job Title: ITBA Trainee\
Location: HCM Office\
Key Responsibilities\
\'b7 Assist in gathering, clarifying, and documenting business and functional requirements;\
\'95 Help prepare documentation such as Business Requirement Documents (BRD), Functional Requirement Documents (FRD), and user stories;\
\'b7\
\'b7\
\'b7\
Create wireframes or mockups using tools like Figma, or similar;\
Coordinate with developers, QA, and project managers to ensure requirement alignment;\
Participate in UAT (User Acceptance Testing), help define test cases and verify outcomes; Join client or internal meetings and take structured meeting notes;\
\'b7 Learn and support Agile/Scrum practices within the development lifecycle.\
Requirements\
\'b7\
\'95\
\'95\
\'95\
Outstanding Academic\
O Background Minimum GPA of 3.0/4.0 or 7.5/10;\
O\
Proficient in English: B2, IELTS 6.0, TOEIC 800, Cambridge C1 (nice to have);\
O Less than 2 years of full-time work experience and available to join full-time; Cultural Fit\
o Proactive, adaptable, and passionate about technology and fintech - key traits for fast growth;\
o Ready to embrace MoMo's mission and core values to drive real impact;\
Leadership Potential\
o Entrepreneurial mindset, innovative thinking, and the ability to adapt in a fast-changing environment;\
o Strong motivation and long-term commitment to career development, with a clear ambition to grow into a future leadership role;\
Department-specific Requirements\
o Strong logical thinking and willingness to learn;\
O Good communication and presentation skills;\
O Familiar with Google Workspace (Docs, Sheets, Slides);\
O\
Exposure to tools like Jira, Trello, Notion, Confluence;\
O Basic understanding of how software systems work (APIs, databases, UI/UX) is a plus;\
O Team player with a proactive attitude and attention to detail.}

items.degree_name: BACHELOR PROGRAM OF INFORMATION TECHNOLOGY, ARTIFICIAL INTELLIGENCE

items.description:
Implemented a rain removal project using Python, LSTM, and ResNet to enhance image clarity in adverse weather.
Focused on removing rain from images to improve traffic light detection accuracy in adverse weather.
Leveraged LSTM's temporal modeling capabilities to capture rain patterns and ResNet's feature extraction power for accurate rain detection and removal.
Successfully restored details and visual fidelity to rain-affected images, contributing to improved object detection.

Developed a novel image restoration method that removes humans from images while preserving background context.
Employed DensePose, OpenPose, and HumanPose for precise human segmentation and pose estimation.
Achieved a better improvement in image restoration quality.

items.certificate_name: Data Science Fundamentals with Python and SQL

cv_analysis_result.cv_summary: Huynh Nam Khoa, a second-year IT student with a 3.42 GPA, seeks an ITBA Trainee internship to apply his AI, machine learning, and programming skills (Python, SQL, JavaScript) to innovative projects. His project experience in image restoration and rain removal using LSTM, ResNet, and other relevant tools demonstrates a strong technical foundation. While he possesses strong technical skills, he may need to highlight experiences related to requirement gathering, documentation (BRD, FRD), wireframing, UAT, and Agile/Scrum practices to directly align with the job description, and further emphasize his communication skills and familiarity with tools like Jira, Trello, Notion, and Confluence. His intermediate English proficiency and proactive learning attitude align with the cultural fit and communication requirements of the role.
cv_analysis_result.alignment_with_jd:
1. **Key Matches**:
    *   **GPA**: The CV mentions a GPA of 3.42, which meets the minimum requirement of 3.0/4.0.
    *   **Skills**: The candidate lists SQL, which is relevant to understanding databases.
    *   **Proactive and Passionate**: The objective statement indicates a passion for AI and machine learning, aligning with the desired cultural fit.
    *   **Willingness to Learn**: The objective mentions a commitment to continuous learning.
    *   **Tools**: Lists Google Colab.

2.  **Missing Elements**:
    *   **Experience**: The CV lacks any explicit mention of experience in gathering requirements, preparing documentation (BRD, FRD, user stories), creating wireframes/mockups (Figma), coordinating with developers/QA/PMs, participating in UAT, or taking meeting notes. These are core responsibilities of the ITBA Trainee role.
    *   **English Proficiency**: While the CV mentions "English (Intermediate)", it doesn't specify a B2, IELTS, TOEIC, or Cambridge C1 score as preferred in the job description.
    *   **Agile/Scrum**: No mention of experience or knowledge of Agile/Scrum practices.
    *   **Google Workspace**: While familiar with Google Colab, the CV doesn't explicitly state familiarity with Google Docs, Sheets, and Slides.
    *   **Project Management Tools**: No mention of Jira, Trello, Notion, or Confluence.
    *   **UI/UX**: The CV does not explicitly mention UI/UX.

3.  **Overall Match Score**: 45/100

4.  **Suggestions for Improvement**:
    *   **Quantify English Proficiency**: If the candidate has a standardized English test score (IELTS, TOEIC, etc.), they should include it to demonstrate proficiency.
    *   **Highlight Transferable Skills**: Reframe project descriptions to highlight skills relevant to the ITBA role. For example, mention if they had to gather requirements from stakeholders, document project specifications, or coordinate with team members.
    *   **Add Relevant Skills**: If the candidate has experience with Agile/Scrum, Google Workspace (Docs, Sheets, Slides), or project management tools (Jira, Trello, etc.), they should add these to the skills section.
    *   **Tailor Objective Statement**: Modify the objective statement to directly address the requirements of the ITBA Trainee role, emphasizing their interest in business analysis, requirements gathering, and project coordination.
    *   **Address the "Missing Elements"**: Even if the candidate lacks direct experience in some areas, they can demonstrate a willingness to learn and quickly adapt to new tools and methodologies. They can mention their interest in learning about Agile/Scrum, UI/UX principles, and project management tools.
    *   **Add Coursework**: Include relevant coursework that demonstrates skills and knowledge applicable to the job description.

items.statement: The candidate is well-suited for roles involving AI, machine learning, and data science, particularly those focused on image processing and restoration.
evidence: Project experience in image restoration and rain removal using LSTM, ResNet
Data Science Fundamentals with Python and SQL

items.statement: Strong programming skills in Python, SQL, and JavaScript.
Proficient in deep learning frameworks and techniques, demonstrated by project experience and certifications.
Experienced with image processing libraries and techniques.
Could benefit from gaining experience in requirement gathering, documentation (BRD, FRD), wireframing, UAT, and Agile/Scrum practices.
Suitable for a Full Stack Software Developer role.
Needs to emphasize communication skills and familiarity with tools like Jira, Trello, Notion, and Confluence.
Has a good foundation in data science and machine learning.
evidence: Data Science Fundamentals with Python and SQL
